info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 27 at 2:05PM PDT until March 29 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM TUESDAY TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Slightly increased snow amounts near Mammoth Lakes and June Lakes. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet along the Sierra crest with 1 to 2 feet in Mammoth Lakes, June Lakes and across higher passes of Highway 395. Elsewhere, total accumulations of 3 to 8 inches are likely. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph in wind prone locations along Highway 395 and above 80 mph along Sierra ridges. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 8 AM Tuesday to 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds will likely create whiteout conditions and considerable drifting of snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There may be a brief break in the snowfall Wednesday morning. However, snow showers are expected to develop late in the morning through the afternoon with additional accumulations expected. Prepare for travel impacts to persist. Latest projections indicate overall additional accumulations will be 1 to 4 inches, although heavier snow showers could produce a bit higher amounts. Winds will be much lighter for Wednesday.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
